definition: A round fruit with red or green skin and a whitish inside.
example_sentence: I ate a red apple for breakfast.

definition: A food made of flour, water, and yeast mixed together and baked.
example_sentence: Can you buy a loaf of bread?

definition: A clear liquid that has no color or taste and is necessary for life.
example_sentence: I drink a lot of water when it is hot.

definition: Feeling or showing pleasure or contentment.
example_sentence: She is very happy with her new toy.

definition: Not large; little in size.
example_sentence: The cat is very small.

definition: To reach a place at the end of a journey.
example_sentence: The train will arrive at 6:00 PM.

definition: To think that something is true or real.
example_sentence: I believe you are telling the truth.

definition: Costing a lot of money.
example_sentence: That car is too expensive for me.

definition: Relating to the present or recent times.
example_sentence: They live in a very modern house.

definition: The act of traveling from one place to another.
example_sentence: It was a long journey across the desert.

definition: To succeed in doing something good, usually by working hard.
example_sentence: She worked hard to achieve her goals.

definition: The general weather conditions usually found in a place.
example_sentence: I prefer a warm, sunny climate.

definition: To talk about something with someone and tell each other your ideas or opinions.
example_sentence: We need to discuss the new project.

definition: Happening often.
example_sentence: He is a frequent visitor to this library.

definition: An occasion or situation that makes it possible to do something.
example_sentence: This job is a great opportunity for you.

definition: To publicly support or suggest a particular way of doing something.
example_sentence: He advocates for a higher minimum wage.

definition: Complete and including everything that is necessary.
example_sentence: The report is a comprehensive guide to the city.

definition: Working or operating quickly and effectively in an organized way.
example_sentence: The new machine is much more efficient.

definition: A particular way of considering something.
example_sentence: Try to see the problem from my perspective.

definition: Large in size, value, or importance.
example_sentence: The findings show a substantial difference.

definition: Having or expressing more than one possible meaning.
example_sentence: His reply to my question was somewhat ambiguous.

definition: Connected with thinking or conscious mental processes.
example_sentence: Some of her cognitive functions have been impaired.

definition: Something that encourages a person to do something.
example_sentence: Bonus payments provide an incentive to work harder.

definition: Solving problems in a sensible way that suits the conditions that really exist.
example_sentence: We need to take a pragmatic approach to the problem.

definition: To produce a substance as a result of a chemical or biological process.
example_sentence: The body synthesizes protein from amino acids.

definition: Different from what is usual, or not in agreement with something else.
example_sentence: The researchers found several anomalous results.

definition: The typical or highest example of a stated quality.
example_sentence: He was the epitome of professionalism.

definition: Continuing in a way that cannot be stopped.
example_sentence: The inexorable progress of science cannot be halted.

definition: Seeming to be everywhere.
example_sentence: Cell phones are ubiquitous these days.

definition: The best or most successful point or time.
example_sentence: His career reached its zenith in the 1990s.

definition: A building that people live in.
example_sentence: My house has a blue door.

definition: To say words; to use your voice.
example_sentence: I speak English and Spanish.

definition: The color of grass or leaves.
example_sentence: The park is very green in spring.

definition: A group of people who are related.
example_sentence: I love spending time with my family.

definition: To take liquid into your mouth and swallow.
example_sentence: Do you want to drink some juice?

definition: The early part of the day.
example_sentence: I wake up at seven in the morning.

definition: A piece of furniture with four legs.
example_sentence: The food is on the kitchen table.

definition: To think that something is true.
example_sentence: I believe you can win the race.

definition: To decide which thing you want.
example_sentence: You can choose between tea and coffee.

definition: Easy to understand or do.
example_sentence: This recipe is very simple to follow.

definition: To go from one place to another.
example_sentence: I want to travel to Japan next year.

definition: To take something and return it later.
example_sentence: Can I borrow your umbrella?

definition: A piece of land surrounded by water.
example_sentence: They spent their holiday on a small island.

definition: A piece of written or spoken information.
example_sentence: I left a message on your phone.

definition: An opinion about what someone should do.
example_sentence: She gave me some very good advice.

definition: A feeling of being relaxed and no pain.
example_sentence: I like to sit in this chair for comfort.

definition: To say what someone or something is like.
example_sentence: Can you describe the man you saw?

definition: To form a picture in your mind.
example_sentence: Imagine you are lying on a beach.

definition: Something that is made or grown to be sold.
example_sentence: This company makes high-quality products.

definition: Happening or doing something often.
example_sentence: He is a regular customer at this cafe.

definition: Achieving the results you wanted.
example_sentence: The party was a great success.

definition: To study something in detail.
example_sentence: We need to analyze the data carefully.

definition: A principle or a general idea.
example_sentence: I struggle to understand the concept.

definition: Facts that show something is true.
example_sentence: There is no evidence against him.

definition: To recognize someone or something.
example_sentence: Can you identify the person in the photo?

definition: To happen or take place.
example_sentence: When did the accident occur?

definition: Closely connected to the subject.
example_sentence: Please only provide relevant information.

definition: An idea that explains how something works.
example_sentence: He developed a new theory of evolution.

definition: To get or buy something.
example_sentence: The company was acquired by a rival.

definition: Supporting one person or group unfairly.
example_sentence: The news report showed a clear bias.

definition: Extremely important or necessary.
example_sentence: Vitamin C is crucial for a healthy diet.

definition: Based on what is seen or experienced.
example_sentence: We need empirical data to prove this.

definition: In a way that cannot be avoided.
example_sentence: Prices will inevitably rise next year.

definition: Exact and accurate.
example_sentence: The instructions were very precise.

definition: To use something in an effective way.
example_sentence: We must utilize all our resources.

definition: Different from what is normal.
example_sentence: The test showed several anomalous results.

definition: Changing mood or behavior suddenly.
example_sentence: She is famous for her capricious nature.

definition: To make something worse.
example_sentence: This will only exacerbate the problem.

definition: Existing as a natural part of something.
example_sentence: There are inherent risks in this plan.

definition: To make something less harmful.
example_sentence: We must mitigate the effects of pollution.

definition: Too eager to praise or obey someone.
example_sentence: He had an obsequious manner toward his boss.

definition: Speech or writing intended to persuade.
example_sentence: We need action, not just empty rhetoric.

definition: Holding tightly to something; persistent.
example_sentence: She is a tenacious negotiator.

definition: Deserving respect because of age or status.
example_sentence: The venerable professor retired last week.

definition: Wanting a lot of something, like food or info.
example_sentence: He is a voracious reader of history.

definition: A common food made from flour and water.
example_sentence: I buy fresh bread every morning.

definition: A young human being.
example_sentence: The child is playing with a ball.

definition: To take liquid into the body.
example_sentence: I drink a lot of water.

definition: Moving at high speed.
example_sentence: He has a very fast car.

definition: To get knowledge or skill.
example_sentence: I want to learn how to cook.

definition: The time when it is dark outside.
example_sentence: The stars are beautiful at night.

definition: To rest with your eyes closed.
example_sentence: I usually sleep for eight hours.

definition: The color of lemons or the sun.
example_sentence: She wore a bright yellow dress.

definition: A container for liquids.
example_sentence: The bottle of milk is in the fridge.

definition: To make or become different.
example_sentence: You can change your mind later.

definition: A large area covered with trees.
example_sentence: They went for a walk in the forest.

definition: A place where people buy and sell.
example_sentence: I buy my vegetables at the market.

definition: A small bag sewn into clothing.
example_sentence: He put the keys in his pocket.

definition: Unusual or surprising.
example_sentence: I heard a strange noise last night.

definition: A very small town in the country.
example_sentence: She grew up in a tiny village.

definition: The power or skill to do something.
example_sentence: He has the ability to speak four languages.

definition: Normal or typical.
example_sentence: The average temperature here is 20 degrees.

definition: A state of physical ease.
example_sentence: These shoes are designed for comfort.

definition: Going straight to a place.
example_sentence: Is there a direct flight to Paris?

definition: To make something clear.
example_sentence: Let me explain how this works.

definition: In good physical condition.
example_sentence: I try to eat a healthy diet.

definition: Usual, ordinary, or expected.
example_sentence: It is normal to feel nervous before a test.

definition: To speak to or deal with a problem.
example_sentence: We must address the issue of safety.

definition: Consisting of many different parts.
example_sentence: The brain is a very complex organ.

definition: Relating to the home or family.
example_sentence: I handle most of the domestic chores.

definition: The natural purpose of something.
example_sentence: What is the function of this button?

definition: Inside an object or body.
example_sentence: The pilot reported an internal failure.

definition: Expressing "no" or a lack of hope.
example_sentence: Don't have such a negative attitude.

definition: A planned piece of work.
example_sentence: Our latest project is almost finished.

definition: Based on ideas rather than things.
example_sentence: Truth and justice are abstract concepts.

definition: The total amount something can hold.
example_sentence: The stadium has a capacity of 50,000.

definition: Very large in size or quantity.
example_sentence: They live in an enormous house.

definition: To cause something to exist.
example_sentence: The new factory will generate many jobs.

definition: An example or single occurrence.
example_sentence: There was another instance of theft.

definition: To buy something.
example_sentence: Tickets must be purchased in advance.

definition: Almost or nearly.
example_sentence: The task is virtually impossible.

definition: Experienced to a maximum degree (bad).
example_sentence: They live in abject poverty.

definition: Having knowledge or being aware.
example_sentence: We are cognizant of the difficulties.

definition: Treating serious issues with humor.
example_sentence: Stop being facetious; this is serious.

definition: Impossible to understand or interpret.
example_sentence: He kept an inscrutable expression.

definition: A small amount of something good.
example_sentence: He hasn't even a modicum of common sense.

definition: The most successful point.
example_sentence: He has reached the pinnacle of his career.

definition: Most noticeable or important.
example_sentence: These are the salient points of the case.

definition: Lasting only for a short time.
example_sentence: The city has a large transient population.

definition: Showing great energy or enthusiasm.
example_sentence: He is a zealous supporter of the cause.
